00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 PGtextevaluators.pl - Macros that generate answer evaluators that handle
00020 questionnaires.
00021 
00022 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00023 
00024     BEGIN_TEXT
00025     WeBWorK is great.
00026     \{ ans_radio_buttons(1=>"Agree",2=>"Disagree") \}
00027     $PAR
00028     If you disagree, why?
00029     \{ ans_rule() \}
00030     END_TEXT
00031     
00032     ANS(ansradio(1));
00033     ANS(anstext(2));
00034     
00035     # FIXME show how to make a grader that sends email here!
00036 
00037 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00038 
00039 This file contians macros for handling questionnaires. Questionnaires can
00040 consist of textual answers and radio buttons, and responses are reported
00041 via email.
00042 
00043 =cut
00044 
00045 BEGIN { be_strict() }
00046 
00047 # Until we get the PG cacheing business sorted out, we need to use
00048 # PG_restricted_eval to get the correct values for some(?) PG environment
00049 # variables. We do this once here and place the values in lexicals for later
00050 # access.
00051 my $BR;
00052 my $PAR;
00053 my $QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS;
00054 my $rh_envir;
00055 sub _PGtextevaluators_init {
00056     $BR                    = PG_restricted_eval(q/$BR/);
00057     $PAR                   = PG_restricted_eval(q/$PAR/);
00058     $QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS = '';
00059     $rh_envir              = PG_restricted_eval(q/\%envir/);
00060 }
00061 
00062 =head1 ANSWER EVALUATORS
00063 
00064 =cut
00065 
00066 # these next three subroutines show how to modify   the "store_ans_at()" answer
00067 # evaluator to add extra information before storing the info
00068 # They provide a good model for how to tweak answer evaluators in special cases.
00069 
00070 =head2 anstext
00071 
00072     ANS(anstext($num))
00073 
00074 anstext() returns an answer evaluator which records the student's answer to a
00075 free-response question in the variable $QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS for later
00076 retrieval. A header is added to the answer before it is added. The header format
00077 is:
00078 
00079     "\n${setNumber}_${courseName}_$psvn-Problem-$probNum-Question-$num:\n"
00080 
00081 Where $num is the argument passed to anstext().
00082 
00083 To send the accumulated answers to the instructor via email, use
00084 mail_answers_to2().
00085 
00086 =cut
00087 
00088 sub anstext {
00089     my $num = shift;
00090     my $ans_eval_template = store_ans_at(\$QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS);
00091     my $psvn  = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::psvn!);
00092     my $probNum     = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::probNum!);
00093     my $courseName  = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::courseName!);
00094     my $setNumber     = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::setNumber!);
00095     
00096     my $ans_eval    = sub {
00097                  my $text = shift;
00098                  $text = '' unless defined($text);
00099                  my $new_text = "\n${setNumber}_${courseName}_$psvn-Problem-$probNum-Question-$num:\n $text "; #    modify entered text
00100                  my $out = &$ans_eval_template($new_text);           # standard evaluator
00101                  #warn "$QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS";
00102                  $out->{student_ans} = escapeHTML($text);  #    restore original entered text
00103                  $out->{correct_ans} = "Question  $num answered";
00104                  $out->{original_student_ans} = escapeHTML($text);
00105                  $out;
00106     };
00107    $ans_eval;
00108 }
00109 
00110 =head2 anstext
00111 
00112     ANS(anstext_non_anonymous($num))
00113 
00114 anstext_non_anonymous() works like anstext(), except that the header added to the
00115 student's answer includes personally identifying information:
00116 
00117     \n$psvn-Problem-$probNum-Question-$num:\n
00118     $studentLogin $studentID $studentName\n
00119 
00120 Where $num is the argument passed to anstext_non_anonymous().
00121 
00122 =cut
00123 
00124 sub anstext_non_anonymous {
00125     ## this emails identifying information
00126     my $num          = shift;
00127     my $psvn   = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::psvn!);
00128     my $probNum      = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::probNum!);
00129     my $studentLogin = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::studentLogin!);
00130     my $studentID    = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::studentID!);
00131     my $studentName  = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::studentName!);
00132 
00133 
00134     my $ans_eval_template = store_ans_at(\$QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS);
00135     my $ans_eval = sub {
00136                  my $text = shift;
00137                  $text = '' unless defined($text);
00138                  my $new_text = "\n$psvn-Problem-$probNum-Question-$num:\n$studentLogin $main::studentID $studentName\n$text "; #   modify entered text
00139                  my $out = &$ans_eval_template($new_text);           # standard evaluator
00140                  #warn "$QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS";
00141                  $out->{student_ans} = escapeHTML($text);  #    restore original entered text
00142                  $out->{correct_ans} = "Question  $num answered";
00143                  $out->{original_student_ans} = escapeHTML($text);
00144                  $out;
00145     };
00146    $ans_eval;
00147 }
00148 
00149 =head2 ansradio
00150 
00151     ANS(ansradio($num))
00152 
00153 ansradio() returns an answer evaluator which records the student's answer to a
00154 multiple-choice question in the variable $QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS for later
00155 retrieval. A header is added to the answer before it is added. The header format
00156 is:
00157 
00158     "\n$psvn-Problem-$probNum-RADIO-$num:\n"
00159 
00160 Where $num is the question number passed to ansradio().
00161 
00162 To send the accumulated answers to the instructor via email, use
00163 mail_answers_to2().
00164 
00165 =cut
00166 
00167 sub ansradio {
00168     my $num = shift;
00169     my $psvn  = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::psvn!);
00170     my $probNum  = PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::probNum!);
00171 
00172     my $ans_eval_template = store_ans_at(\$QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS);
00173     my $ans_eval = sub {
00174                  my $text = shift;
00175                  $text = '' unless defined($text);
00176                  my $new_text = "\n$psvn-Problem-$probNum-RADIO-$num:\n $text   ";         # modify entered text
00177                  my $out = $ans_eval_template->($new_text);           # standard evaluator
00178                  $out->{student_ans} =escapeHTML($text);  # restore original entered text
00179                  $out->{original_student_ans} = escapeHTML($text);
00180                  $out;
00181      };
00182 
00183    $ans_eval;
00184 }
00185 
00186 =head2 store_ans_at
00187 
00188     $answer = "";
00189     ANS(store_ans_at(\$answer));
00190     TEXT("Stored answer: '$answer');
00191 
00192 Generates an answer evaluator which appends the student's answer to a scalar
00193 variable. In addition, the score for the answer is always set to 1. This macro
00194 is used internally by anstext(), anstest_non_anonymous(), and ans_radio().
00195 
00196 =cut
00197 
00198 sub store_ans_at {
00199     my $answerStringRef = shift;
00200     my %options = @_;
00201     my $ans_eval= '';
00202     if ( ref($answerStringRef) eq 'SCALAR' ) {
00203         $ans_eval= sub {
00204             my $text = shift;
00205             $text = '' unless defined($text);
00206             $$answerStringRef = $$answerStringRef  . $text;
00207             my $ans_hash = new AnswerHash(
00208                              'score'            =>  1,
00209                              'correct_ans'          =>  '',
00210                              'student_ans'          =>  $text,
00211                              'ans_message'          =>  '',
00212                              'type'             =>  'store_ans_at',
00213                              'original_student_ans'     =>  $text,
00214                              'preview_text_string'      =>  ''
00215             );
00216 
00217         return $ans_hash;
00218         };
00219     }
00220     else {
00221         die "Syntax error: \n The argument to store_ans_at() must be a pointer to a scalar.\n(e.g.  store_ans_at(~~\$MSG) )\n\n";
00222     }
00223 
00224     return $ans_eval;
00225 }
00226 
00227 =head2 [DEPRECATED] mail_answers_to
00228 
00229     ANS(mail_answers_to($to_address))
00230 
00231 Returns an answer evaluator which accepts the last answer and then mails the
00232 answer to $to_address. It is unsupported and may not even work.
00233 
00234 Use a normal textans() answer evaluator and mail_answers_to2() instead.
00235 
00236 =cut
00237 
00238 #  This is another example of how to modify an  answer evaluator to obtain
00239 #  the desired behavior in a special case.  Here the object is to have
00240 #  have the last answer trigger the send_mail_to subroutine which mails
00241 #  all of the answers to the designated address.
00242 #  (This address must be listed in PG_environment{'ALLOW_MAIL_TO'} or an error occurs.)
00243 
00244 # Fix me?? why is the body hard wired to the string QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS?
00245 
00246 sub mail_answers_to {  #accepts the last answer and mails off the result
00247     my $user_address = shift;
00248     my $ans_eval = sub {
00249 
00250         # then mail out all of the answers, including this last one.
00251 
00252         # this is the old mechanism for sending mail (via IO.pl)
00253         #send_mail_to(  $user_address,
00254         #           'subject'           =>  "$main::courseName WeBWorK questionnaire",
00255         #           'body'              =>  $QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS,
00256         #           'ALLOW_MAIL_TO'     =>  $rh_envir->{ALLOW_MAIL_TO}
00257         #);
00258         
00259         # DelayedMailer is the new method (for now)
00260         $rh_envir->{mailer}->add_message(
00261             to => $user_address,
00262             subject => "$main::courseName WeBWorK questionnaire",
00263             msg => $QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS,
00264         );
00265 
00266         my $ans_hash = new AnswerHash(  'score'     =>  1,
00267                         'correct_ans'   =>  '',
00268                         'student_ans'   =>  'Answer recorded',
00269                         'ans_message'   =>  '',
00270                         'type'      =>  'send_mail_to',
00271         );
00272 
00273         return $ans_hash;
00274     };
00275 
00276     return $ans_eval; 
00277 }
00278 
00279 =head2 [DEPRECATED] save_answer_to_file
00280 
00281 Returns an answer evaluator which accepts the last answer and then stores the
00282 answer to a file. It is unsupported and may not even work.
00283 
00284 =cut
00285 
00286 sub save_answer_to_file {  #accepts the last answer and mails off the result
00287     my $fileID = shift;
00288     my $ans_eval = new AnswerEvaluator;
00289     $ans_eval->install_evaluator(
00290             sub {
00291                  my $rh_ans = shift;
00292 
00293                  unless ( defined( $rh_ans->{student_ans} ) ) {
00294                     $rh_ans->throw_error("save_answers_to_file","{student_ans} field not defined");
00295                     return $rh_ans;
00296                 }
00297 
00298                 my $error;
00299                 my $string = '';
00300                 $string = qq![[<$main::studentLogin> $main::studentName /!. time() . qq!/]]\n!.
00301                     $rh_ans->{student_ans}. qq!\n\n============================\n\n!;
00302 
00303                 if ($error = AnswerIO::saveAnswerToFile('preflight',$string) ) {
00304                     $rh_ans->throw_error("save_answers_to_file","Error:  $error");
00305                 } else {
00306                     $rh_ans->{'student_ans'} = 'Answer saved';
00307                     $rh_ans->{'score'} = 1;
00308                 }
00309                 $rh_ans;
00310             }
00311     );
00312 
00313     return $ans_eval;
00314 }
00315 
00316 =head1 OTHER MACROS
00317 
00318 =head2 mail_answers_to2
00319 
00320     mail_answers_to2($to, $subject);
00321 
00322 Sends the text accumulated in $QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS to the address specified in
00323 $to. The email is given the subject line $subject.
00324 
00325 The mail message is not sent right away; instead, the message is recorded and
00326 sent by WeBWorK after PG rendering has completed. 
00327 
00328 =cut
00329 
00330 sub mail_answers_to2 {
00331     my ($to, $subject, $ra_allow_mail_to) = @_;
00332     
00333     $subject = "$main::courseName WeBWorK questionnaire" unless defined $subject;
00334     warn "The third argument (ra_allow_mail_to) to mail_answers_to2() is ignored. The list of allowed addresses is fixed."
00335         if defined $ra_allow_mail_to;
00336     
00337     $rh_envir->{mailer}->add_message(
00338         to => $to,
00339         subject => $subject,
00340         msg => $QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS,
00341     );
00342     
00343     return;
00344 }
00345 
00346 =head2 escapeHTML
00347 
00348     escapeHTML($string)
00349 
00350 The misnamed macro returns a copy of $string in which each newline has been replaced with
00351 an HTML BR element.
00352 
00353 =cut
00354 
00355 sub escapeHTML {
00356     my $string = shift;
00357     $string =~ s/\n/$BR/ge;
00358     $string;
00359 }

00362 
00363 =cut
00364 
00365 sub save_questionnaire_answers_to {
00366     my $fileName =shift;
00367     SaveFile::printAnswerFile($fileName,[$QUESTIONNAIRE_ANSWERS]);
00368 }

00384 sub DUMMY_ANSWER {
00385     my $num = shift;
00386     qq{<INPUT TYPE="HIDDEN" NAME="answer$num" VALUE="">}
00387 }
